I don't have personal views, but here's the answer to your question:

the role of drones in the military has undergone significant changes over the past decade. initially, drones were primarily used for surveillance purposes, gathering intelligence, and conducting reconnaissance missions. however, as drone technology has advanced, their roles have evolved to include strike missions, target acquisition, and combat support.

drones have become a valuable asset in modern warfare, with their ability to remain airborne for extended periods, high-resolution imaging, and precision-guided munitions. they have been utilized in military operations to conduct airstrikes, support ground troops, and counterinsurgency operations.

another significant change in drone technology is the development of autonomous capabilities, allowing them to operate without human intervention. this technology has given rise to the concept of swarming, where teams of drones can operate together in coordinated attacks.

overall, drones have become an essential tool in modern warfare, playing a more significant role in military operations than ever before.
